You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Load Storefront Data from a Static Resource

To easily add custom object records, custom settings, and configuration metadata for a storefront to your org, you can create and load a static resource. You can define all the storefront data that you want to load, or supplement existing data with more records.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS
NEEDED
To create static resources:	Customize Application
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set

B2B Commerce for Visualforce installs two storefront data static resources in your org.

CC_Data_DefaultStore
A full set of data for a store named DefaultStore, with settings, objects, and configuration data for a fictional company called Capricorn Coffee. This data set includes the following records, making it useful for training, demonstrations, and development:
Sample products for all product types, including bundles, kits, dynamic kits, aggregated products, assembly products, attribute-driven commerce (ADC).
Sample pricing strategies, including subscriptions and tiered pricing.
Sample account groups and price lists, which demonstrate different entitlement scenarios.
Sample coupons, which demonstrate different types of discounts.
Sample promotions.

This example data set also supports the following optional features, which are available but not enabled by default:

Line-level independence (LLI) checkout
Effective accounts
Locale switching for an internationalized storefront, including demo data set content translated into Japanese and pricing strategies with JPY price lists.
CC_Data_DefaultStore_Min
A minimum set of data for a store named DefaultStore, with only the settings, objects, and configuration data required to load the storefront in the browser. This data set doesn’t have any predefined products, categories, menus, accounts, or promotions, making it a good starting point for defining your own storefront data.
To use the CC_Data_DefaultStore data set, skip to step 5. To use the CC_Data_DefaultStore_Min resource as a starting point for your own storefront data, first download the resource.
From Setup, enter Static Resources in the Quick Find box, and then select Static Resources.
To filter the list of static resources, click C, and then click CC_Data_DefaultStore_Min.
In the static resource detail, click View file to download it to your local system.
Open the downloaded ZIP folder and copy the contents to a safe working directory on your local system. Rename the root folder to something unique.
In your working directory, create your custom settings, custom object records, and configuration metadata using the required JSON format and folder structure.
NOTE You can’t create multiple storefronts with the same name. Make sure that the customsettings/ccrz__E_StorefrontSettings__c.json file in your data set specifies a unique storefront name.
TIP If you’ve already loaded data for a storefront and you want to load more records, you can scope your static resource. For example, say that you want to add 500 product records to a storefront that already has other product records. You can create a JSON file that defines all the new products you want to add, and include only this data in your static resource. Check out the list of supported object types you can create records for using this method.
Compress the files and folders of your working directory into a ZIP file.
Upload the ZIP file to your org’s static resources.
From Setup, enter Static Resources in the Quick Find box, and then select Static Resources.
Click New, complete the following fields for the static resource, and save.
FIELD	VALUE
Name	Enter a meaningful name for the static resource.
File	Enter the ZIP file you created.
Cache Control	Select Public.
Load the data from the static resource into your storefront.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select Global Settings (1).
In the Global Settings menu, select Data Loader (2).
In the Load Storefront Data section (3):
To use the Capricorn Coffee demo data set from the CC_Data_DefaultStore static resource, select Demo data (coffee products) for the DefaultStore.
To use the minimum DefaultStore data set from the CC_Data_DefaultStore_Min static resource, select Minimum data required to start building a storefront.
To use custom storefront data that you've created, select Your custom storefront data.
If you selected custom storefront data, enter the name of the static resource that you created (4).
Click Load Data (5).
IMPORTANT

When you load data in CC Admin, B2B Commerce for Visualforce checks FLS settings on your admin profile for the data you're trying to load.

For custom objects, such as CC Products, B2B Commerce for Visualforce grants full access to the default System Administrator profile by default.
For fields on standard objects that B2B Commerce for Visualforce depends on, such as account, the default System Administrator profile has visibility for most fields. But, some fields can be hidden depending on your org edition. In particular, the Annual Revenue field on the standard account object can be hidden for the System Administrator profile. If a required field isn't visible for your admin profile, B2B Commerce for Visualforce fails to load data and returns an FLS error for a particular object.

Update FLS settings on the affected object for your custom profile, or switch to a different profile that has the necessary access enabled. B2B Commerce doesn't check FLS on custom settings.

Static Resource Format for Storefront Data
The Load Storefront Data section of CC Admin | Global Settings | Data Loader accepts a static resource that contains JSON-formatted definitions of B2B Commerce for Visualforce custom settings and custom objects. Data Loader supports only a subset of custom settings and objects, and requires a specific folder structure depending on the data you’re loading.
SEE ALSO

Adjust Field-Level Security for B2B Commerce for Visualforce Objects

title: Loading Storefront Data from a Static Resource in Salesforce
